intro: Fadyenia fadyenii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, often forming dense clusters of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are highly prized in horticulture for their beauty and ease of care. Fadyenia fadyenii thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
